lead_paragraph: SCAGLIONE--Carolyn, M.D.,of Englewood, NJ died on January 10, 2016, age 88. Known professionally as Carolyn R. Denning, M.D., she was an internationally recognized pediatrician and one of the leading experts in the field of Cystic Fibrosis research and care. Carolyn Rebecca Denning was born on May 30, 1927 in Detroit, MI. She was raised in Franklin, KY and graduated from University of Kentucky in 1947. She graduated from Tulane University School of Medicine with an M.D. degree in 1952. After her internship and residency, she completed a pulmonary fellowship in 1957 at Babies Hospital, at Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center where she worked with Dr. Dorothy Andersen and the group that originally described CF. She spent the remainder of her career in the Metropolitan New York City area. From 1963-1977, she served as Director of Cystic Fibrosis and Pediatric Pulmonary Disease Centers of Babies Hospital, at Columbia Presbyterian. In 1977, she founded the Cystic Fibrosis, Pediatric Pulmonary and GI Center at St. Vincent's Hospital, and served as its Director until retiring in 1995. For over 40 years she cared for hundreds of patients with CF and formed lasting bonds with their families. She trained many of the CF caregivers who are practicing throughout the world today, upholding her standards of care and compassion. She is survived by her husband of 59 years, Peter R. Scaglione, M.D., four sons and seven grandchildren. The family will receive friends at Barrett Funeral Home, 148 Dean Drive, Tenafly, NJ, on Friday, January 15 from 6-9pm and Saturday, January 16 from 12-4pm (3pm Remembrance). In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Research Fund for Cystic Fibrosis, 455 Oradell Ave., Oradell, NJ 07649. A memorial service will be held at later date. 1/3
